metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2329 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
libavcodec/tiff.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.6 does not properly validate RowsPerStrip values and YCbCr chrominance subsampling factors, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF file, related to the tiff_decode_tag and decode_frame functions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1').
